snippet: New York City fire officials on Thursday said they were investigating whether the blast, which killed two women and injured 13 people last week, was touched off by an accelerant.
abstract: Officials rule out natural gas as cause of Brooklyn explosion that destroyed three-story building, killing two women and injuring 13 people; fire marshals say they are investigating possibility that some kind of fuel, like gasoline, or other accelerant was cause.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: New York City fire officials on Thursday said they were investigating whether the blast, which killed two women and injured 13 people last week, was touched off by an accelerant.

headline.main: Natural Gas Not the Cause of Deadly Brooklyn Explosion, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Natural Gas Ruled Out as Culprit in Brooklyn Explosion
